subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|糸|t1=thread|隹|c1=s|c2=p|ls=psc}}.

The original pronunciation of {{och-l|隹|tr=*ɢʷi}} was lost after the classical period, but can still be seen in other characters of the phonetic series:
* {{och-l|惟|to think}},
* {{och-l|唯|only}},
* {{och-l|雖|although}},
* {{och-l|帷|curtain, screen}} and
* {{och-l|淮|Huai River}}.

subSections.title: Readings
Notes
subSections.text:
*As in historical readings "すゐ", "つゐ", "るゐ", most dictionaries do not have "ゆゐ" as a historical reading for 維. According to historical data, the on-reading of 維 is "ゆい". However, the Dai Kanwa Jiten, has the "ゆゐ" and related -wi historical on-readings.

{{attention|ja|please confirm this, this is translated from the Japanese Wikipedia}}
